definition: being or from or characteristic of another place or part of the world, a form of life assumed to exist outside the Earth or its atmosphere, to arouse hostility or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness
details:
adjective
- being or from or characteristic of another place or part of the world
= example: being or from or characteristic of another place or part of the world
= synonyms: exotic
- not contained in or deriving from the essential nature of something
= example: not contained in or deriving from the essential nature of something
= synonyms: foreign
noun
- a form of life assumed to exist outside the Earth or its atmosphere
= synonyms: extraterrestrial
- a person who comes from a foreign country
= synonyms: foreigner, noncitizen, outlander
- anyone who does not belong in the environment in which they are found
= synonyms: unknown
verb
- to arouse hostility or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness
= example: to arouse hostility or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness
= synonyms: estrange, alienate, disaffect
- to transfer property or ownership
= example: to transfer property or ownership
= synonyms: alienate
